result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 02:29 PM Defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner in court with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow, by telephone.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by telephone. Sentencing on Ct 2 to address sentence after revocation.  9 month jail concurrent time served. Atty Guelzow agrees and explains to def. and def. understands and def. agree with agreement.  Atty Guelzow makes statement. Def. has nothing. Court orders 9 months jail, concurrent with all other sentence deemed time served.  Court obligations converted to civil judgment. Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 9, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

from DOC regarding Ct. 2
Routed to JA

Defendant Richard R. Burnett-Hoeppner in court with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Defendant Richard R. Burnett-Hoeppner in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 17CF65, 17CM263, 11CF183, and 16CF16 @ 9:33 a.m. Sentencing after revocation on 11CF183 and 16CF16 ct 1 and sentencing after PSI on 17CF65 and 17CM263. Parties have review revocation packets and PSI. State has no additions or corrections. Atty Guelzow states corrections to PSI report on pages 8, 10 and 11. State gives recommendation and sentencing arguments. Recommends on 11CF183 7 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, credit for 705 days; 16CF16 - 3 yrs prison, 1 yr ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 692 days; 17CF65 - 7 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, credit for 520 days; 16CM263 - 9 months jail, no credit. All to run concurrent. 17CF65 would be controlling sentence. State advises restitution of $33.44 in 17CM263. Asks Court to adopt Dept's conditions of ext. supervision. State has complied with VWNR. Atty Guelzow presents sentencing arguments. Advises that Def already paid the restitution. Asks for time served regarding confinement, and probation. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Will follow State's recommendation. Orders on 17CF65 ct 1 - 7 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, credit for 520 days served, Court costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. 11CF183 ct 1 - 7 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, credit for 705 days. Concurrent - all cases. Civil judgment. 17CM263 - 9 months jail, no credit, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge, $33.44 restitution if not already paid. 16CF16 ct 1 - 3 yrs prison, 1 yr ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 692 days. Civil judgment. 11CF183 Def not eligible for SAP. 17CF65 Def is eligible for SAP. Def eligible for CIP on both. Postconviction rights. Statement by Atty Guelzow. Costs on 17CM263 to be collected on 17CF65 extended supervision.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner in court, in custody with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 11CF186, 16CF16 & 16CF17 @ 3:31 pm. State gives agreement, waive p.h. in 16CF16, plea to both ct's, 16CF17 DRI into 16CF16, 16CF16 ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs & restitution 500 ct 2 30 days jail consecutive to revocation case & costs, 11CF186 Not going to order more the 2 years confinement.  Atty Guelzow agrees with agreement.  State has reviewed revocation packet and no corrections.  Atty Guelzow reviewed revocation packet and no corrections. 16CF16, Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over. Information Filed. Atty Guelzow has copy of information & waives reading. Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge & penalties.  Ct 1 Fleeing, no contest plea, Ct 2 Resisting, no contest plea.  DRI for sentencing 16CF17 both ct's. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understand elements.  Atty Guelzow is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Fleeing in ct 1 & Resisting in Ct 2.  State gives sentencing recommendation on all cases. Atty Guelzow gives sentencing argument. Credit for 386 days. Def. makes statement.  ALB makes statement. Mother of defendant makes statement. Court gives statement 
11CF186  Ct 3 1 year jail, completed, 386 credit time served, Cost converted to civil judgment, 491.95 costs, & 335.00 supervision fees Court going with DOC's amount & ordering DOC supervision fees, ct 2 Already Discharged on, 
16CF16 Ct 1  60 days jail, consecutive to 11CF186, 21 days credit.
Ct 2 - 60 days jail, consecutive to ct 1 & 11CF186
Huber privileges, take back withheld sentence on ct's 1 & 2 3 year probation, 60 days jail, on ct 1 & 60 days on ct 2 consecutive to each other & 11CF186, Huber privileges, ct 1 3 years probation  ct 1, ct 2 1 year probation, concurrent to each other, Court talks on credit, Court orders on ct1 39 days jail, 21 days credit if revoked, court costs, 250 DNA ct 1, 200 DNA ct 2, Restitution $500 from 16CF17, Huber privileges, Def. advised of firearm rights & voting rights. DNA Sample already provided.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court not telling probation not to have a no contact provision.
Attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing date  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner in court via video, with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 16CF16 and 16CF17.  Statement by Atty Guelzow.  Received 1 complaint previously and just received other complaint today.  Bond has been set with conditions.  Bond will continue.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Preliminary hearing requested.
No contact with G. V. or J. Z.

Defendant Richard Robert Burnett-Hoeppner in court, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF16, 16CF17 @ 8:45 a.m. Def had hired Atty Kronenwetter on 11CF186. Statement by Def's mother. Def on probation hold on 11CF186. State heard on bond for new files. Court sets bond to cover both files. Def has received copies of both complaints. Charges and possible penalties reviewed. Atty rights reviewed.  11CF186 called @ 8:52. Same appearances. Was scheduled for sentencing after revocation. Atty Kronenwetter does not appear. Court will adjourn to 4/11/16 @ 1:30 for status conf.  Court will not require anything to be filed by Atty Kronenwetter if Def hires new counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
